lines.content: Orion is a ChatBot based off the Duke greenfield project template, created for NUS's CS2103T Software Engineering module.
Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Orion.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Orion.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
ASCII Art Generator for Logo: https://patorjk.com/software/taag/
* The Orion class represents the main chatbot application.
* It handles the initialization of the UI, storage, and task list,
* and contains the main logic for running the chatbot.
* Indicates whether the chatbot is online and should continue running.
* The UI component responsible for handling user interaction.
* The storage component responsible for loading and saving tasks.
* The task list that holds the tasks loaded from storage or created during runtime.
* Initializes the UI, storage, and task list.
* Greets the user and loads tasks from storage.
* If tasks cannot be loaded, initializes an empty task list.
* Starts the main loop of the chatbot.
* Continuously reads and executes commands from the user until the exit command is given.
* The main method that starts the Orion chatbot application.
* The {@code Parser} class is responsible for parsing user input into executable commands.
* It processes input strings and returns the appropriate {@link Command} object.
* Removes the first word from a given string.
* @param str the string from which the first word is to be removed
* @return the string with the first word removed
* Parses the user input and returns the appropriate {@link Command} object.
* @param input the user input string to parse
* @throws OrionException if the input is invalid or cannot be parsed into a valid command
protected static Command parse(String input) throws OrionException {

Event event = new Event(mapped[0].trim(), mapped[1].trim(), mapped[2].trim());
throw new OrionInputException("Correct syntax: delete <task number>");
throw new OrionInputException("Correct syntax: delete <task number>");
throw new OrionInputException("Correct syntax: find <search query>");
throw new OrionInputException("Please provide a supported command!");

* If the file does not exist or is corrupted, a new file is created.

*                        if the file cannot be found or created.
throw new OrionTaskDataException("Unrecognised todo task format");

throw new OrionTaskDataException("Unrecognised event task format");
Task event = new Event(parsed[2], done, start, end);
throw new OrionTaskDataException("Task list not found, new list created");
throw new OrionPathNotFoundException("Task list cannot be created");
throw new OrionTaskDataException("Task list corrupted, new list created");

* The {@code Ui} class handles all interactions with the user. It provides
* methods for printing messages to the console and reading user input.
* The class is responsible for displaying various user interface elements
* such as greetings, task lists, and error messages.

* A horizontal bar used to visually separate sections in the console output.
* An indentation string used to format printed messages with indentation.

printIndent("Sure! I've added the following task to your list:");
printIndent("Now you have " + tasks.getNoTasks() + " tasks in your list.");
* Prints a message indicating that a task has been deleted from the task list.

* Prints an error message to the console.

* @param storage the {@link Storage} for managing the task list

* Represents an abstract command in the system.
* A command encapsulates an action that can be executed, such as adding or
* removing a task. Commands can be executed against a {@link TaskList},
* {@link Storage}, and {@link Ui}. The {@code isExit} flag determines if
* the command should terminate the current process.
* Constructs a {@code Command} with the specified exit flag.
* @param isExit a boolean indicating if the command should terminate
* The specific behavior of the command is defined in subclasses. This
* method interacts with the given {@link TaskList}, {@link Storage},
* and {@link Ui} to perform the command's action.
* @param tasks  the {@link TaskList} to perform actions on
* @param storage the {@link Storage} for managing data
* @param ui      the {@link Ui} for updating the user interface
* @throws OrionException if an error occurs during execution
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) throws OrionException;

* @return {@code true} if the command should terminate the current process,

public void execute(TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) throws OrionException {
throw new OrionInputException("Please provide a positive task number!");

* Represents a base exception class for all exceptions related to the Orion application.
* This abstract class extends {@link Exception} and is used as a base class for
* custom exceptions in the Orion application. It allows for the creation of specific
* exception types with custom error messages.
public abstract class OrionException extends Exception {
* Constructs a new {@code OrionException} with the specified detail message.
* @param message the detail message that describes the reason for this exception
* Represents an exception that is thrown for invalid input commands.
* This exception is used to signal that an input command is not valid or does not
* meet the expected format or criteria in the Orion application.
* Constructs a new {@code OrionInputException} with the specified detail message.
* @param message the detail message that describes the reason for this exception
* Represents an exception that is thrown when a specified path cannot be found.
* This exception is used to indicate that a requested path, such as a file or directory,
* does not exist or cannot be located in the Orion application. It is thrown when Orion
* Storage is unable to create a new file to store the user task list.
* Constructs a new {@code OrionPathNotFoundException} with the specified detail message.
* @param message the detail message that describes the reason for this exception
* Represents an exception that is thrown when there is an issue saving the task list.
* This exception indicates that an error occurred during the process of saving the task
* list, which may involve issues such as file access problems.
* Constructs a new {@code OrionSaveTaskListException} with the specified detail message.
* @param message the detail message that describes the reason for this exception
* Represents an exception that is thrown when there is an issue with task data.
* This exception indicates that the task data is corrupted or invalid, which
* might occur if the existing task list is not in the expected format or is otherwise
* Constructs a new {@code OrionTaskDataException} with the specified detail message.
* @param message the detail message that describes the reason for this exception

* @param time the deadline of the task as a {@code LocalDate}

* The task is initialized as not done.
* @param body the description of the task
* @param deadline the deadline of the task as a string in the format "yyyy-mm-dd"
* @throws OrionException if the deadline string cannot be parsed into a {@code LocalDate}
public Deadline(String body, String deadline) throws OrionException {
+ " Please input a valid date in the correct format!");

throw new OrionInputException("Your start date must be earlier than your end date!");
+ "Please input valid dates in the correct format!");

* Returns a string representation of the {@code Event} for saving to a file.

* Represents an abstract task with a description and completion status.
* Constructs a {@code Task} with the specified description.
* The task is initialized as not done.

throw new OrionInputException("Task has already been set as completed!");

throw new OrionInputException("Task has already been set as uncompleted!");
* Returns a string representation of the task.
* The format is "[X] description" if the task is done, or "[ ] description" if the task is not done.
* @return the string representation of the task
* Returns a string representation of the task for saving to a file.
* The format is "T,description" if the task is done, or "F,description" if the task is not done.
* @return the string representation of the task for saving
* Represents a task that does not have a specific deadline or date.

event national dog feeding day /from tomorrow's tomorrow /to the next day after that
